Title: One Million Exposed to Adware via Hijacked Chrome Extension
Intro: Over one million users were exposed to adware after the developer of a highly popular Chrome extension fell victim to a phishing attack.  [Read More]

Title: Chrome, Firefox Users Exposed to Unicode Domain Phishing
Intro: Chrome, Firefox and Opera expose their users to phishing attacks that rely on Unicode domain names  [Read More]

Title: Anti-Phishing Feature in Beta Version of Google Chrome Poses Security Risks: Researchers
Intro: The new anti-phishing feature currently being tested in the experimental version of Google Chrome does not work as well as intended and poses security risks.  [Read More]

Title: Malicious Chrome Extensions Targeting Facebook
Intro: Researchers at Kaspersky Labs have found examples of malicious Chrome applications targeting Facebook users in Brazil.  [Read More]

Title: Half Million Impacted by Four Malicious Chrome Extensions
Intro: Four malicious Chrome extensions managed to infect over half a million users worldwide, including employees of major organizations, ICEBRG reports.  [Read More]

Title: Fake Chrome Font Update Attack Distributes Backdoor
Intro: A malicious campaign targeting users of the Chrome web browser on Windows systems recently started distributing a remote access Trojan.  [Read More]

Title: Fake Chrome Font Update Attack Distributes Ransomware
Intro: A malware campaign targeting Chrome users with fake font update notifications is now distributing ransomware instead of ad fraud malware.  [Read More]

Title: Chrome Users Targeted in Malware Campaign
Intro: A recently observed malware distribution campaign has been specifically devised to target users of the Chrome browser on Windows-based computers.  [Read More]

Title: Malicious YouTube Pages Targeting Chrome Users
Intro: Researchers at Zscaler have discovered a fake YouTube page that is hosting malicious Chrome extensions. Such pages, as seen in the past, prey on the uninformed users with poorly patched systems to spread malware.  [Read More]

Title: Google Boosts Extension Protections in Chrome
Intro: Google is adding an additional layer to Chrome’s defenses, which are designed to prevent potentially unwanted extensions from being installed. The latest enhancements build on the previous ones, which focused on silent installations.  [Read More]

Title: Test Shows IE9 Beats Chrome, Safari, Firefox in Overall Malware Detection
Intro: In a recent test conducted by NSS Labs, Internet Explorer performed the best, blocking 95 percent of malicious activity  [Read More]

Title: New Research Says Chrome Browser "Most Secured" Against Attacks
Intro: Security research firm Accuvant, today released the results a study comparing the security of the three most widely used web browsers – Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, and Microsoft Internet Explorer.  [Read More]

Title: Chrome Throws Flash Into the Sandbox
Intro: Google announced today that it will be extending the Web browser’s existing sandboxing technology to Flash Player plug-in in the Windows version of Chrome.  [Read More]

Title: Microsoft Discloses Code Execution Flaw in Chrome
Intro: Microsoft discloses details of CVE-2017-5121, a remote code execution vulnerability affecting Chrome  [Read More]

Title: Chrome to Label FTP Resources as "Not Secure"
Intro: Google has decided that starting with Chrome 63 resources delivered over FTP will be labeled “not secure”  [Read More]

Title: Google Wants Symantec Certificates Replaced Until Chrome 70
Intro: Google releases final proposal in the case of Symantec’s CA business – all certificates must be replaced by Chrome 70  [Read More]

Title: TLS Bug in Blue Coat Proxy Breaks Chromebooks, PCs
Intro: Buggy TLS 1.3 implementation causes Blue Coat proxies to break thousands of Chromebooks and PCs in a single organization  [Read More]

Title: Attackers Exploited Chrome Zero-Day to Deliver Android Trojan
Intro: Cybercriminals delivered the Svpeng Trojan to Android users via Google AdSense and a zero-day flaw in Chrome  [Read More]

Title: Google Brings Safe Browsing to Chrome for Android
Intro: Google has launched Google Safe Browsing technology in its Chrome browser for Android, a feature meant to keep users safe from malware, unwanted software, and social engineering sites.  [Read More]

Title: Researcher Hijacks Android Phone via Chrome Vulnerability
Intro: Chinese researcher Guang Gong demonstrated how an Android device can be hijacked by exploiting a JavaScript v8 vulnerability through the Chrome browser.  [Read More]

Title: Info-Stealing Malware Disguised as Google Chrome Update Discovered in Android Devices
Intro: An info-stealing Android malware has been found spreading under the guise of a Google Chrome update.

Title: Google to Completely Ban WoSign, StartCom Certificates in Chrome 61
Intro: Google warns websites using WoSign and StartCom certificates - they will no longer be trusted by Chrome starting in September  [Read More]

Title: Google Tightens Security Rules for Chrome Extensions
Intro: Google has updated its User Data Policy for the Chrome Web Store, in an attempt to improve the safety and privacy for users of its Chrome web browser.  [Read More]

Title: Google Accused of Tracking Students via Chromebooks
Intro: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) has filed a complaint with the United States Federal Trade Commission (FTC), claiming that Google is spying on students with the help of Chromebooks.  [Read More]

Intro: Google has released a preview version of a new Chrome extension designed to give users the ability to encrypt, decrypt, digital sign, and verify signed messages within their Web browser using OpenPGP.  [Read More]

Title: Chrome DRM Flaw Enables Movie Piracy

Title: HTTP Sites Should Be Marked as Non-Secure: Chrome Security Team

Intro: Starting in October 2017, publicly trusted website certificates will have to comply with Chrome’s Certificate Transparency (CT) policy to be trusted by the browser.  [Read More]

Title: Chrome to Mark HTTP Connections as Non-Secure

Title: Google to Disable SSL 3.0 in Chrome 40 to Prevent POODLE Attacks

Title: Google to Enforce Extension Hosting Policy on All Chrome Channels

Intro: The prompts follow other efforts by Google to help users whose browser settings have been changed by suspicious extensions.  [Read More]
